meanings.definition: Feeling or showing distress or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The troubled child looked sad and worried.
meanings.sent2: She had a troubled expression on her face.
meanings.sent3: The troubled puppy couldn't find its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The troubled sky warned of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: His troubled thoughts kept him awake at night.

meanings.sent1: The troubled news left everyone feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent2: Her troubled words lingered in his mind.
meanings.sent3: The troubled alarm clock refused to stop ringing.
meanings.sent4: The troubled path through the forest was treacherous.
meanings.sent5: The troubled waters made swimming dangerous.

meanings.sent1: The troubled project faced many obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The troubled computer kept crashing unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The troubled road was full of potholes.
meanings.sent5: The troubled student struggled to understand the lesson.
